title: The creation of ReadStats should take into account the user configuration of sample_num
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?

https://github.com/tikv/tikv/commit/a7d1595f5486616be34e0cf2bbf372edb5f0e85a

### What did you expect?

The `sample_num` of `ReadStats` should be updated along with the user config. However, in the current implementation, TiKV uses `ReadStats::default()` to create each `ReadStats` without considering the actual `sample_num` config.

https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/a7d1595f5486616be34e0cf2bbf372edb5f0e85a/components/raftstore/src/store/worker/split_controller.rs#L397-L404

https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/a7d1595f5486616be34e0cf2bbf372edb5f0e85a/src/storage/metrics.rs#L26-L34

### What did happened?

If the user adjusts the default config and sets a large `sample_num`, the Load Base Split may not work due to the insufficient number of the sampled key range.
